content:
I've seen this "mistake" happened a couple of times now, e.g. https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/69471
People try to r? a_team. Is there a reason that rust highfive ignores/doesn't understand this? If not, it seems like a useful change, right?
Also useful when a team member wants to reassign to another team member at random. Because as we all know, humans are bad at randomness.
@Lukas Kalbertodt I'm sure there's an issue open for this in the highfive repo
it's a matter of not being implemented
yes, and it's not likely to be in highfive I think, trivial once we migrate to triagebot
@centril You're right. Sorry for not checking beforehand. You created the issue: https://github.com/rust-lang/highfive/issues/187
it's on my todo list, hopefully soon :)
Unfortunately, this code is written in python, so that makes it much more bug prone and harder to contribute to
